text: Can we talk about it in January?

elements.text: Can we talk about it in January?

text: <@U7Z4938R3> Oh I understand. I was really just wondering what kinds of models you were using. I am working on a discrete stochastic simulation, looking at hiring practices in universities. So it is genuinely discrete because the hiring tends to happen at the beginning of a school year, and retirements happen at the end of the school year. There are many books on continuous time SDEs, etc, but not that much on discrete stochastic simulations. Chris just said I might be able to use some of the approaches in your package. But if you don't want to share yet, that is cool. But really I was just wondering what kinds of models you were using. Like the term "state space models" gets used in so many different contexts.

elements.text: Oh I understand. I was really just wondering what kinds of models you were using. I am working on a discrete stochastic simulation, looking at hiring practices in universities. So it is genuinely discrete because the hiring tends to happen at the beginning of a school year, and retirements happen at the end of the school year. There are many books on continuous time SDEs, etc, but not that much on discrete stochastic simulations. Chris just said I might be able to use some of the approaches in your package. But if you don't want to share yet, that is cool. But really I was just wondering what kinds of models you were using. Like the term "state space models" gets used in so many different contexts.

text: Oh yes, and I also have some data on this process, so I need an algorithm that will let me calibrate against the data :slightly_smiling_face:.

elements.text: Oh yes, and I also have some data on this process, so I need an algorithm that will let me calibrate against the data

text: The DSSM package combines a lot of crap together - which will be split up eventually.  Most of it is doing complicated perturbation solutions for control.  Talk january!

text: Okay cool. Yeah January will be just fine. Have a good holiday.
